intro: Cheilanthes standleyi, commonly known as the standley's rockcap, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is a terrestrial, epiphytic, or lithophytic plant, typically found growing on rocks or in rocky crevices. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome with a dense, tufted crown of dark green, leathery leaves. Its fronds are usually pinnately compound, with a distinctive, often recurved shape. The spores are produced in small, round sori that are located on the underside of the fronds.
